name: Lair of the Cheese-Fiend
tagline: Dense, gloomy, moss-carpeted woods of birch, yew, and elm. Stagnant puddles abound.
description: Dense, gloomy, moss-carpeted woods of birch, yew, and elm. Stagnant puddles abound. Within the Ring of Chell: True fairies are afflicted with a spiritual malaise; teleportation and summoning are ineffectual; magic of illusion or charm has a 2-in-6 chance of failure.

points_of_interest.name: Blood-Cheese Sacs
points_of_interest.description: A region where the skins of various large creatures—including breggles and humans—hang among the trees. The skins are carefully sealed into sacs, bloated and distended with their strange contents: a reddish black, cheese-like substance made from blood rather than milk. The stuff has many forms (slimy, runny, stringy, hard), but smells and tastes like cheese.
points_of_interest.interior: Inside the skins: The skins are carefully sealed into sacs, bloated and distended with their strange contents: a reddish black, cheese-like substance made from blood rather than milk.
points_of_interest.exploring: If players spend time investigating the skins, there is a 2-in-6 chance of the cheese-fiend wandering nearby, checking the state of the skins.
special_features: 2-in-6 chance of cheese-fiend appearing when investigating

points_of_interest.name: Giant Hut
points_of_interest.description: A ramshackle hut of giant proportions (15′ high), cobbled together from stone, thatch, and branch. Small, odd-shaped windows allow a peek inside. 10′ high door of roughly nailed planks, eminently creaky. An acrid stench of strong cheese emanates from the hut, to a near vomit-inducing potency.
points_of_interest.entering: Door: 10′ high, of roughly nailed planks, eminently creaky.
points_of_interest.interior: The hut consists of a single room, unlit. There is a 4-in-6 chance of the cheese-fiend being present in the hut, either dozing or skinning a corpse. The odour of strong cheese is overwhelming here; characters must Save Versus Doom or suffer a –1 penalty to Attack Rolls for 1d4 Rounds. Dangling from the rafters is a grisly collection of fresh corpses and drying skins. In a corner, a rusty metal tank filled with guts and bones. A great, oaken worktable and cleavers. A bed of dried leaves.
points_of_interest.exploring: Searching: A pouch with eighteen kunzites (100gp each) lies forgotten in a dark corner. One of the hanging corpses still wears a copper, knot-work engraved bracelet (200gp) and matching ring (a Ring of Water Walking).
points_of_interest.inhabitants: There is a 4-in-6 chance of the cheese-fiend being present in the hut, either dozing or skinning a corpse.
special_features: Save Versus Doom or suffer –1 penalty to Attack Rolls for 1d4 Rounds due to overwhelming cheese odor

npcs.name: The Cheese-Fiend
npcs.description: A giant woman of obese, lumpy form, 10′ tall, formed entirely of different kinds of cheese: eyes oozing, rubbery, bouncy flesh, hairy regions of fuzzy mould, an oozing Swiss-cheese air-pocket mouth.
desires: Driven only by the urge to hunt and gorge herself on cheese
Treasures real cheese or milk (only has access to the blood-cheese that she produces)
npcs.stat_reference: Level 9 AC 12 HP 50 Saves D7 R8 H9 B10 S11, Att 2 fists (+7, 2d6) or molten cheese vomit (4d6), Speed 40 Morale 9 XP 1,350

items.name: Eighteen Kunzites
items.location: Giant Hut, forgotten in dark corner

dm_notes: Immunities: Bludgeoning weapons bounce off the cheese-fiend's rubbery flesh, inflicting half damage. Molten cheese vomit (thrice a day): Affects all characters in a 10′ radius area in front of the fiend's mouth. Save Versus Blast for half damage. Treasure: The creature's body, if sliced into reasonably sized portions could be sold to a discerning cheesemonger for up to 2,000gp.
